title: Ticket #2695: 90 minute timeout in CCB listener
description:
The following was observed, and leads one to the suspicion that CCBListener::ReadMsgFromCCB() might have blocked for 90 minutes. In all my testing with a debugger, the socket timeout is set to CCB_TIMEOUT (300) when this function is called, so I cannot explain how the read could have blocked for 90 minutes. The error reported by recv() is ETIMEDOUT. This seems rather unexpected for a non-blocking read.

remarks:
2011-Dec-06 17:40:08 by danb:
I am adding more details in the logging when ETIMEDOUT happens. This will tell us what the timeout was set to in condor_read(), and it will tell us how long condor_read() actually took.

I am also explicitly setting the socket timeout in CCBListener::ReadMsgFromCCB(), even though it should already be set when the connection was first made.
